newsitem.title: USA: U.S Oct spending gain points to solid growth in Q4.
newsitem.headline: U.S Oct spending gain points to solid growth in Q4.

text.p: A respectable 0.5 percent increase in U.S. consumer spending in October indicates fourth-quarter economic growth probably got off to a solid start, analysts said.
"It does suggest that the quarter's starting on a better note," said Evelina Tainer, chief economist at Indosuez Carr Futures.
"I think, if we continue at this pace, it'll make the fourth quarter look a lot better than the third quarter," she added.
